messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Designing clothing
messages.msgSnippet: We love Sheep to Shawl - here, they set up a festival in the Spring and you can spend a couple of days going through each step, learning in some detail how the
messages.messageBody:
We love Sheep to Shawl - here, they set up a festival in the
Spring and you can spend a couple of days going through each
step, learning in some detail how the steps are done. The 6 y.o.
and I are about ready to replace the emus with some sheep, though
friend husband remains enamoured of the "dinosaurs" in the back
yard.
----- Original Message -----
From: <SandraDodd@...>
To: <Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Sunday, January 19, 2003 10:01 PM
Subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Designing clothing


|
| In a message dated 1/19/03 8:39:03 PM, jnjstau@... writes:
|
| << You might contact your local county extension agent. At
least in Texas,
| clothing design and sewing are big activities in 4-H. >>
|
| OH YES!
|
| And here, I don't know if it's 4-H but there is THE coolest
contest called
| "Sheep to Shawl," where people raise the sheep, spin the
thread, weave (or
| knit or crochet) and make a garment. WOW. I was stunned the
first time I
| saw their stuff.
|
| Sandra
|
| ~~~~ Don't forget! If you change topics, change the subject
line! ~~~~

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Designing clothing
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/19/2003 11:02:50 PM Eastern Standard Time, ... When we lived in CA, there was a cute craft shop that had these beautiful, VERY large
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/19/2003 11:02:50 PM Eastern Standard Time,
SandraDodd@... writes:


> And here, I don't know if it's 4-H but there is THE coolest contest called
> "Sheep to Shawl," where people raise the sheep, spin the thread, weave (or
> knit or crochet) and make a garment. WOW. I was stunned the first time I
> saw their stuff.

When we lived in CA, there was a cute craft shop that had these beautiful,
VERY large Christmas stockings. The tag said, "Stocking knitted by Mary/Wool
donated by Bessie". TOO SWEET!


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Designing clothing
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 1/19/03 8:39:03 PM, jnjstau@gvtc.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 1/19/03 8:39:03 PM, jnjstau@... writes:

<< You might contact your local county extension agent. At least in Texas,
clothing design and sewing are big activities in 4-H. >>

OH YES!

And here, I don't know if it's 4-H but there is THE coolest contest called
"Sheep to Shawl," where people raise the sheep, spin the thread, weave (or
knit or crochet) and make a garment. WOW. I was stunned the first time I
saw their stuff.

Sandra

messages.subject: Designing clothing
messages.msgSnippet: You might contact your local county extension agent.  At least in Texas, clothing design
messages.messageBody:
<<my 10 year old daughter is very interested in designing clothing>>

You might contact your local county extension agent. At least in Texas,
clothing design and sewing are big activities in 4-H.

Julie
